intro: Launaea nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its spiny, leafless stems and small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Launaea nudicaulis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
